title: Ringo Starr cancels North America tour with Covid
description: The Beatle had previously cancelled dates after catching the virus, before returning to the road.

title: Why the Parkland gunman was spared the death penalty
description: A Florida jury's decision left relatives angry and upset - but was a result of the state's death penalty law.

title: The Papers: 'Truss has days' as 'MPs tout Mordaunt and Sunak'
description: Friday's headlines are dominated by mounting talk of a full U-turn on the recent mini-budget.

title: Parkland parents: 'I'm as stunned as the day Luke was killed'
description: Families tell the BBC they believed until the last minute their children's killer would be executed.

title: Chris Mason: Can Liz Truss salvage her premiership?
description: "A government that's barely begun is confronting questions about its end," our political editor writes.

title: Fujitsu: How a Japanese firm became part of the Post Office scandal
description: The story of how a software firm based thousands of miles away became embroiled in the UK scandal.

title: Electricity prices vary by nearly 4p per unit
description: People in North Wales and Mersey pay the highest rate for their electricity, new figures reveal.

title: Mini-budget U-turn on the table as pressure mounts
description: Discussions continue but many Tory MPs believe changes to the economic plan are inevitable.

title: National Television Awards: Emmerdale praised by King Charles as soap wins big
description: The National Television Awards 2022 also celebrates wins for Ant and Dec (again) and This Morning.

title: Footage shows Pelosi seeking help during riots
description: The Speaker of the House is seen talking to Virginia governor to request additional law enforcement.

title: West Ham United 2-1 Anderlecht: Jarrod Bowen and Said Benrahma score as Hammers progress
description: West Ham guarantee a place in the Europa Conference League knockout stage with a win over Anderlecht in Group B.

title: Manchester United 1-0 Omonia Nicosia: Scott McTominay scores stoppage-time winner
description: Manchester United leave it late as Scott McTominay scores a stoppage-time winner over Omonia Nicosia in the Europa League.

title: New crisis looms for Ukrainians in the UK
description: For many refugees, the six months British hosts agreed to house them for is up. So what happens now?

title: January 6 committee issues subpoena for Trump to testify
description: The vote to issue Trump with a subpoena legally requires him to testify under threat of penalty.

title: Wasps & Worcester: 'If it can happen to a club the size of Wasps, who else might it happen to?'
description: Former England wing Ugo Monye expresses concern about the potential knock-on effect of Wasps and Worcester's financial difficulties.

title: Watch: Turkey MP smashes phone with hammer in parliament
description: Burak Erbay was protesting against a proposed government-backed bill aimed to combat 'disinformation'.

title: How big are Donald Trump's legal problems?
description: It can be difficult to keep track of the ex-president's legal battles - here's what you need to know.

title: Riba Stirling Prize: Cambridge University library wins top architecture award
description: Magdalene College Cambridge's "exquisitely detailed" new library wins the Riba Stirling Prize.

title: Princess Amalia: Security fears force Dutch princess from student home
description: Her parents gave details in an emotional encounter with the press, during a state visit to Sweden.

title: Gaia Pope's family call for alleged rapist review
description: The family of the 19-year-old say police failed to properly investigate her claim of being attacked.

title: Premier League predictions: Chris Sutton takes on Liverpool fan Ian Broudie of the Lightning Seeds for this weekend's games
description: Chris Sutton takes on Liverpool fan Ian Broudie of the Lightning Seeds to pick his winners and losers from this weekend's Premier League games.

title: Parkland school shooting: Families devastated as gunman spared death
description: The gunman will spend life in prison, but relatives and prosecutors had sought the death penalty.

title: National Television Awards 2022: The best red carpet images
description: Stars gathered in London on Thursday for the NTAs, a month later than planned.

title: Bodo/Glimt 0-1 Arsenal: Bukayo Saka scores as Gunners near Europa League progression
description: Arsenal take a big step towards qualifying for the Europa League knockout stage with a slender win at Bodo/Glimt.

title: France sends Germany gas for first time amid Russia energy crisis
description: The new flow was sent in "European solidarity" after Russia cut energy supplies to Europe.

title: Leah Croucher: Forensics in teen murder case could take weeks
description: Police continue to search a house for evidence as they probe the murder of teenager Leah Croucher.

title: Fiorentina 5-1 Hearts: Conference League hopes hang by a thread for Scots
description: Hearts are thrashed by a rampant Fiorentina to leave their Conference League progression hopes hanging in the balance.

title: Netflix ad-supported service to launch in November
description: The firm is rolling out the less expensive offering to try to attract viewers.

title: Jamaica bans music and TV glorifying crime
description: Jamaica's broadcasting commission is banning content that encourages "illegal activity".

title: Track Cycling World Championships: Great Britain men's team pursuit gold
description: Great Britain beat Olympic champions Italy to win men's team pursuit gold in a thrilling final at the 2022 Track Cycling World Championships in Saint-Quentin-en-Yvelines, France.

title: Where are the other bits of the government's growth plan?
description: As well as tax cuts, ministers are promising a series of changes in policy to boost economic growth.

title: Channel 4 criticised for Jimmy Carr show involving Hitler painting
description: A TV show will see a studio audience decide whether the comedian should destroy a painting by Hitler.

title: Bullying of Charley-Ann Patterson 'did not cross criminal threshold'
description: Charley-Ann Patterson took her own life in 2020 after being verbally abused online and in school.

title: Russia to move people from Kherson as Ukraine advances
description: Civilians in the Russian-occupied Kherson region are urged to "save themselves" from Ukrainian rockets.

title: Woman accused of lockdown rave has case thrown out
description: Allegations of a lockdown party in Sheffield are dropped due to a "defective charge".

title: Gary Lineker tweet broke impartiality rules, says BBC complaints unit
description: A complaint made after the Match of the Day presenter posted about the government is upheld.

title: Gijon Open: Andy Murray beats Pedro Cachin in three sets
description: Andy Murray reaches the quarter-finals of the Gijon Open by coming from a set down to defeat Pedro Cachin.

title: Rwanda three-week removals plan revealed
description: Asylum seekers could be sent to Rwanda three weeks after their arrival in the UK, High Court hears.

title: In full: Kwasi Kwarteng's BBC interview amid U-turn rumours
description: Kwasi Kwarteng admits there was 'some turbulence' in the economy after last month's mini-budget.

title: Quiz of the week: Where did Ed Sheeran pop up?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on over the past seven days?

title: Malala Yousafzai visits Pakistan after deadly floods
description: The activist travelled to the country for the second time, since she was shot by the Taliban in 2012.

title: Kwarteng sidesteps questions on mini-budget U-turn
description: Asked about speculation he could drop parts of his plan, the chancellor says "our position hasn't changed".

title: Emma Hayes: Chelsea manager has emergency hysterectomy because of endometriosis
description: Chelsea manager Emma Hayes says she expects to make a full recovery but will take time away from the club as she recovers from surgery.

title: Murder accused seen dragging suitcase on street for hours, jury told
description: Jurors see CCTV of Jemma Mitchell at the home of a woman she is accused of killing and decapitating.

title: Nurse accused of murder 'cared deeply about babies'
description: Lucy Letby was a dedicated nurse who cared deeply for the babies and their families, a court hears.

title: Public responds to NHS amber alert over donor blood stocks
description: More than 10,000 appointments have been booked in the past 24 hours.

title: Neath Labour MP Christina Rees suspended from party
description: Ms Rees, who has represented Neath since 2015, loses whip pending an investigation

title: Two Huawei 5G kit-removal deadlines put back
description: A small number of companies argued the original targets risked network outages, the government says.

title: Alex Jones: 'Moment of reckoning' for Infowars conspiracist
description: The Infowars host faces huge damages - but will it make a difference to online lies?

title: Oxford University: Goldfish do have good memories, scientists find
description: A special tank was used to train nine fish to find if they can measure distance.

title: Fabrice Muamba: Snapchat CPR lessons will save lives
description: Snapchat releases a "lens" that teaches people how to use chest compressions for cardiac arrest.

title: Film agent cleared of dangerous driving after activist jumped on car
description: YouTuber Michael Van Erp told a jury he fell on to Paul Lyon-Maris's car "like a crash test dummy".

title: Consumers urged to cut energy use this winter
description: Energy watchdog Ofgem will launch a campaign to cut consumption and ensure the UK has enough supplies.

title: Diego Maradona 'Hand of God' football set to be sold at auction for £2.5-3m
description: The ball used by Diego Maradona for his infamous 'Hand of God' goal for Argentina against England in the 1986 World Cup quarter-final is set to be sold by the referee in charge.

title: Rugby League World Cup: Dominic Young set for first England cap against Samoa
description: Winger Dominic Young is preferred to England's leading try-scorer Ryan Hall for Saturday's game against Samoa in Newcastle.

title: Republic of Ireland: Uefa to investigate women's players over pro-IRA chant
description: Uefa opens an investigation into "potential inappropriate behaviour" by Republic of Ireland women's players after their win over Scotland.

title: China Covid: Rare protest against President Xi before party congress
description: The protest against President Xi came amid strict Covid measures that have also sparked anger online.

title: Edenfield Centre: Minister backs public inquiry over abuse
description: An undercover BBC investigation found patients being humiliated, verbally abused and bullied by staff.

title: Lucy Letby trial: Murder-accused nurse wrote 'I am evil', trial told
description: Post-it notes were found at Lucy Letby's home including one reading "I killed them", her trial hears.

title: Wasps & Worcester: Rob Andrew calls for Premiership and RFU to join forces amid cash crisis
description: Rob Andrew says Premiership Rugby and the Rugby Football Union should join forces to address financial problems within the game.

title: Sepsis: Quadruple amputee on waiting list for double hand transplant
description: A quadruple amputee says a rare double hand transplant will be "such an amazing gift".

title: 'Rare' Roman mosaic found in Rastan, Syria
description: Officials say the 1,600-year-old panel depicting classical myths is the most complete of its kind.

title: Queen premiere previously unheard Freddie Mercury song Face It Alone
description: The song, called Face It Alone, was originally recorded for the band's 1989 album The Miracle.

title: Housing slowdown warning after mortgage rates rise
description: The warning comes as the Bank of England says the number struggling to pay mortgages could hit a 15-year high.

title: Changing PM would be disastrous, warns foreign secretary
description: James Cleverly says Liz Truss will stick to her economic plans despite Tory unrest over her tax cuts.

title: Ava White: Sister says death will never sink in
description: Mia White, whose 12-year-old sister Ava was murdered, urges young people not to pick up knives.

title: Rugby World Cup: England's Sarah Hunter 'immensely proud' of caps record
description: England captain Sarah Hunter is "immensely proud" to become the side's joint most-capped player, but says her sole focus currently is the World Cup.

title: Aamir Khan: Minister asks Bollywood star to avoid ‘anti-Hindu’ ads
description: Bollywood actor Aamir Khan's recent ad for a bank has sparked outrage among Hindu right-wingers.

title: Bondi Rescue: Hatfield boy who saved toddler surprised by TV hero
description: Cooper was shocked to meet his idol, Australian TV star Bruce Hopkins, who heard about the rescue.

title: Women's football & diversity: 'We don't want anyone feeling it's not their game'
description: England women's captain Leah Williamson and team-mate Lotte Wubben-Moy discuss their concerns about the lack of diversity in women's football.

title: Channel migrants: Smugglers claim boat shortages affecting crossings
description: Smugglers in migrant camps are now demanding nearly £3,000 per person to cross the Channel.

title: Ukraine Azovstal: Released man says Azov fighters kept in inhumane conditions by Russia
description: A Ukrainian fighter besieged at Mariupol tells the BBC he was held in solitary confinement by Russia.

title: 'Speaking about the 22 babies I lost is seen as taboo'
description: Imtiaz Fazil, who had 17 miscarriages and saw five children die, says she wants more discussion about loss.

title: Tuition fees may be axed for hundreds of migrants
description: Scottish ministers are being forced to change the law on tuition fees for hundreds of migrant students after a landmark court case.

title: Channel migrants: 116 children missing from UK hotels
description: The children disappeared after being temporarily put up in hotels by the Home Office.

title: Royal Mail workers walk out in first of 19 days of strikes
description: No letters will be sent during the strike, but medical deliveries will be prioritised.

title: Did the mini-budget cause market turmoil?
description: The government has defended its mini-budget following market turmoil and a higher cost of borrowing.

title: Parenting Hell: Beckett and Widdicombe podcast 'redressing the balance'
description: Rob Beckett and Josh Widdicombe on why Parenting Hell, which now has a companion book, struck a chord.

title: Inside the Met unit investigating police abuse claims
description: A team aiming to restore public trust has been launched by the Metropolitan Police after series of scandals.

title: Lost Desert Island Discs: Collector finds more than 90 missing recordings
description: Bing Crosby, Margot Fonteyn, James Stewart among the interviews that have been found and restored.

title: Elgin Marbles: New body aims to return sculptures to Greece
description: Conservative parliamentarians join an organisation campaigning to return the sculptures to Greece.

title: Over-50s set to be invited for Covid booster and flu jab in England
description: About 12 million more people will be able to book their winter vaccinations from Friday.

title: Operating theatres go unused as NHS backlog grows
description: Surgeons left frustrated as hospitals struggle to return routine services to full strength.

title: Analysis: Has Liz Truss driven herself into a cul-de-sac?
description: As the PM attends her first weekly audience with the King, the markets and country wonder what's next.

title: Ethiopia's civil war: Inside Tigray's capital Mekelle
description: As the war in Ethiopia's Tigray region intensifies, the BBC gets an exclusive report from its main city.
